thread.title: Latest Air New Zealand video: Rugby stars try 'Men in Black' schtick
thread.title_full: Latest Air New Zealand video: Rugby stars try 'Men in Black' schtick

author: Ben Mutzabaugh , USA TODAY
title: Latest Air New Zealand video: Rugby stars try 'Men in Black' schtick
text:
An image promoting the new Air New Zealand "Men in Black"-themed safety video. (Photo: Air New Zealand)
Tags Sports Illustrated Rip Torn Air New Zealand Richard Simmons Betty White Tommy Lee Jones RW 13 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Rugby collides with Hollywoord for the theme of the latest safety video for Air New Zealand, which has earned a reputation in recent years for its creative spin on the mandated safety demonstrations.
The newest video features the All Blacks – New Zealand's world power national rugby team. The All Blacks team up with other international rugby stars for a video inspired by t he "Men in Black" movie franchise that rose to fame with Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones.
Neither of those actors appear in the video, which instead focuses mostly on rugby stars. The list of rugby stars includes All Blacks coach Steven Hansen as well as players Richie McCaw, Dan Carter and Israel Dagg. International stars include David Campese and former English team captain Martin Johnson.
USA TODAY
WATCH: Betty White's latest starring role on Air New Zealand
While neither Smith nor Jones appear in the movie, there is one "Men in Black" actor who makes a cameo. That would be American Rip Torn, who reprises his role as Chief of the Men in Black.
Air New Zealand collaborated with "Men in Black" producer Sony Pictures for the video, which includes movie-themed sets and outer-space aliens.
"We recently extended our sponsorship of the All Blacks and New Zealand Rugby through until 2020 and thought what better way to celebrate than with a safety video," Jodi Williams, Air New Zealand's Head of Global Brand Development, says in a statement.
"We've worked with the All Blacks on previous safety videos and thought it would be fun this time around to have them step into the shoes of the other highly trained Men in Black. The result is not only entertaining but makes people sit up and take notice of the key safety messages," Williams adds.
Air New Zealand's other recent creative and quirky safety videos have featured personalities like Betty White , Richard Simmons and stars from the Hobbit movie. Others have featured hunky rugby stars, surfers , Sports Illustrated swimsuit models and a cheeky "Nothing to hide" video featuring nearly naked crew.
TWITTER: You can follow me at twitter.com/TodayInTheSky
USA TODAY
Surfers star in Air New Zealand's latest safety video

Stephen Brashear, Getty Images Fullscreen EVERETT, WA - JULY 9: Crews work on the engine of an Air New Zealand Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner, July 9, 2014 in Everett, Washington. The 787-9 Dreamliner was the first delivery of the long-haul version of the 787 featuring a fuselage 20 feet longer than the 787-8.
